p.s: Family gatherings can be a chance for family members to reconnect and bond with each other .
If you happen to be hosting one , here are some tips to help you plan and host a fun reunion of your immediate family .

item.s: Be precise but flexible when inviting family members .
In too many situations , hosts can be overly unclear on arriving times , or they can be too strict .
The best thing to do is create a window of time that is appropriate for a guest to arrive at your house .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Do n't make all the food yourself .
Ask a person in each family unit to prepare a dish .
If they are famous for a certain dish in your family , ask them to make that .
Keep an even balance between appetizers , entrees , and desserts .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 2 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Decide what parts of your house are off-limits .
Inform each person as they walk in your door , and if you feel the need , make signs and tape them to doors of off-limits areas .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Keep children in mind .

Chances are that small children may be running around your house , and since the adults will most likely going to be occupied , leave out some child-friendly toys and activities in a common space , like a living room .
These items could be :

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 4 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Board games
Toy cars or blocks
Video games
Television ( block all inappropriate channels )
Privately tell an older child , minimum age 12 , that they need to keep an eye on younger kids .
This will retain order in rooms where there is not constant adult supervision .
You can include a small monetary incentive , like $ 2 per hour .
Remind them not to be too “ bossy ” and to simply resolve small quarrels and retrieve adult help in case of problems on a bigger scale , like physical fighting or injuries .
This also gives a preteen a sense of importance , which is always good .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 5 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Purchase assorted crackers , chips , cheeses and dips .
Display them nicely on a coffee table or in a dining room .
This can be a common space where all guests are allowed , which gives them an opportunity to converse and bond , which is the goal of your party .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 6 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Create an adult dinner table and a kid 's dinner table .

Chances are that you will not have room for all family members to dine together in the same room , so the practical thing to do is seat the children in the kitchen and the adults in the formal dining room .
Remember to check in on the kids occasionally .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 7 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Finally , say goodbye to all your guests as they leave your house .
This may be the last impression they have of you for a while , and you never know when you will see them again .

figure.rend: Host a Family Gathering Step 8 Version 2.jpg

item.s: A clean , childproof house
Appetizers , entrees , and desserts
Patience
